amendment.description: Amendment sought to require the Chairman of the SEC to be trained on ethical standards and codes of conduct to ensure all regulations enacted are not done so with a conflict of interest.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 5 printed in Part A of House Report 115-3 to require the Chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission to be trained on ethical standards and codes of conduct to ensure all regulations enacted are not done so with a conflict of interest, specifically regarding prior employment and legal representation of too-big-to-fail banks.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Raskin amendment (A005) Failed by recorded vote: 196 - 231 (Roll no. 49).

action.text: House amendment offered/reported by : Amendment (A005) offered by Mr. Raskin.
House amendment not agreed to: On agreeing to the Raskin amendment (A005) Failed by recorded vote: 196 - 231 (Roll no. 49).
Amendment failed in Committee of the Whole
Roll call votes on amendments in House
